node.text: Young people are the ones who will be most affected by nature and biodiversity loss. That is why around the globe more and more of them are speaking up to protect our planet. World leaders are finally starting to understand that the planetary crisis is an intergenerational crisis too. #iucncongress #Connect2Earth

node.title: The planetary crisis is an intergenerational crisis too.

node.text:
We are witnessing a planetary crisis unfold in real time.

Wildfires, floods: it’s never been clearer that our relationship with nature is broken. So where do we go from here? 👇 #WWFUntangled

We need to start working WITH nature instead of AGAINST nature. Nature-based solutions harness the power of the natural world in a way that benefits us and all life on this planet. 🌍

Did you know that, if all mangroves were lost or destroyed, 15 million more people would be affected by floods across the world each year? 

And that forests provide clean air and water, protect against erosion and landslides, and help to regulate the climate by removing carbon from the atmosphere? 🌊🌲

The natural world does so much to sustain and protect us. We must do more to help it thrive, and we must do it now. Double tap if you agree!

#NaturePositive #WWF #Biodiversity #Climate #ClimateChange #GlobalWarming #ClimateCrisis #ClimateAction #SaveThePlanet  #NoPlanetB #ClimateChangeIsReal #ClimateStrike #ClimateEmergency #ClimateJustice

node.text: Young people like @louisedgmabulo @thejordansanchez @niriaalicia are using their voice to make our food systems more sustainable and fair! If you love food🥗 and creating videos🎥 you can too! We've partnered with @world_food_forum & @unep to launch the #Actors4Change video challenge in the search for videos that showcase inspiring, diverse, and impactful solutions in improving our #FoodSystems. Find out more in the link in bio.

node.text:
This is Mondzongo Ruth Belvanie, the first female government ranger in Ntokou Pikounda National Park, Republic of Congo 💚🐘 Ruth is a trailblazer and an inspiration for so many women looking to make their mark in conservation and protect our planet 🌍

#FemaleRanger #NtokouPikounda #ElephantConservation #WomenEmpowerWomen #ElephantsOfInstagram #Elephants #Conservation #NatureLovers #OurPlanetDaily #NaturePhotography #PlanetEarth

node.text:
What have the world’s best known environmentalists learned over the past 60 years? 🤔
And what is the next generation of activists doing to tackle the threats facing our planet? 🌍

Environmental legends discuss all this and more in our Forces of Nature podcast 🎙️

Subscribe now - tap the link in our bio.

#WildlifeConservation #ForcesOfNature #Podcast #NatureDocumentary #WWF #SaveThePlanet  #NoPlanetB

node.text: We’re beyond excited to join Biologist and UN Ambassador for Migratory Species, Sacha Dench in the largest global 🌎 effort to set the #GuinnessWorldRecords title 🏆 for the most people pledging climate action in one month! Join her on this adventure and commit to take climate action via the #CountUsIn platform. Are you in? Go to: climatechallenge.live

node.text: Tomorrow, we celebrate #BiodiversityDay and all the fascinating species of the world 🌱🐾 Let’s remind ourselves of why we need to mend our relationship with nature, to protect our health and the shared planet we call home 🌎#Connect2Earth #ForNature

node.title: We Must Protect Our One Home

node.text:
🐼It’s WWF’s 60th anniversary. Together, over the past 60 years, we have come a long way to build a future where people and nature can thrive 🐘👩‍🦱🌍This would not have been possible without you by our side.

🙏We have achieved so much but there's still so much more to be done! Your support will be crucial over the next decade as we continue to take action for people and nature. 

Follow the link in our bio to find out how you can get involved and continue the journey with us 🙏

#TogetherWeCan

#Conservation #Conservationist #BetterTogether #ProtectWildlife #ProtectNature #ProtectOurPlanet #SaveOurPlanet #PositiveVibes #ClimateCrisis #ClimateAction #SaveThePlanet  #NoPlanetB #ClimateChangeIsReal #StopPlasticPollution #NatureIsBeautiful #NatureShooters #Nature_Hub #Nature_Perfection #NaturePic

node.text:
💡Take part in the #EarthHour Virtual Spotlight and get the world talking by sharing this video. 2020 taught us just how important distance is, but the scale of the issues facing our planet can only be solved if we unite. 

The past year has shown that we have it in us to make a difference, to build a stronger and better future. A light shines brighter through the darkness - every share matters 🙏

#EarthHour2021 #Connect2Earth #NatureLovers #ProtectEarth #ProtectNature #OurPlanetDaily #ClimateAwareness #ClimateAction #NatureInspiration #NaturePhotography #NaturesBeauty #SaveThePlanet #NaturesWonder #ForNature #ClimateCrisis

node.title: 🌍⏳See our planet in a new light this #EarthHour

node.text:
🥘What we eat and how we grow food are harming people and planet. But a few changes can make it part of the solution to nature loss and the #ClimateCrisis.
 
Share this video to your stories to tell world leaders we want urgent action to better protect our planet!⏰
 
#TheRaceIsOn #UNGA

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by WWF International on September 14, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'We must fix our broken relationship with nature. © Andre Dib WWF WWF-Brazil Brazil'.

node.text:
⚠️Our world is in crisis. We need transformative action #ForNature and we need it now. #TheRaceIsOn for leaders to step up efforts to tackle nature loss and the climate crisis.

So, where do we go from here? Leaders and reps from 193 countries are coming together to discuss big topics - from our food systems to pandemics this month. 🌍

This is a CRUCIAL moment to inspire greater action to protect nature and people from the worst impacts of the climate and nature crisis. What happens now affects each and every one of us. Tap the link in our bio to learn more!

#Covid19 #UNGA #UNGA76 #ClimateCrisis #ClimateChange #NatureCrisis #Nature #COP26 #COP15

node.text:
⚠️The cost of plastic is higher than you might think⚠️

🥤The production, consumption and disposal of plastic impose significant negative impacts which are currently not accounted for in the price of plastic.

🔊We cannot keep paying the price of inaction, we need systemic change, this is your moment. 

📢World leaders are due to meet at UN Environment Assembly in February 2022 to discuss a legally binding global agreement on marine plastic pollution. Will you join over 2.1 million people calling for action? Follow the “help stop plastic pollution” link in our bio to make your voice heard. 

#PlasticTreaty #StopPlasticPollution #PlasticPollutes #NoToPlastic #PlasticFree #ProtectNature #ProtectPeople #ProtectOceans #OceanLife

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by WWF International on September 10, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'What are the hidden costs of #PlasticPollution? You might be surprised. EstebanVegaLa-Rotta/WWF a-Rotta Esteban Vega'.

node.text:
What are the hidden costs of #PlasticPollution? We need a global #PlasticsTreaty. You can join over 75 businesses and 2.1 million people calling governments to take action at the UN Environment Assembly in February 2022 Follow the link in our bio to sign the petition to #StopPlasticPollution

#PlasticTreaty #StopPlasticPollution #PlasticPollutes #NoToPlastic #PlasticFree #ProtectNature #ProtectPeople #ProtectOceans #OceanLife

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by WWF International on September 10, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'What are the hidden costs of #PlasticPollution? You might be surprised. EstebanVegaLa-Rotta/WWF a-Rotta Esteban Vega'.

Photo by WWF International on September 10, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'By 2040 plastic will account for up to 20% of the entire global carbon budget, accelerating the climate crisis Patrick Federi Unsplash WWF'.

Photo by WWF International on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, child, outdoors and text that says 'Incineration plants are built predominantly in low-income and marginalised communities exposing them to heatr and economic risks. rstock WWF'.
Photo by WWF International on September 10, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text.

Photo by WWF International on September 10, 2021. May be an image of body of water and text that says 'By 2040, plastic pollution entering the ocean is expected to triple to 29 million tonnes. © Naja Bertolt Jensen Unsplash WWF'.

Photo by WWF International on September 10, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'If no action is taken, the lifetime costs of the plastic produced in 2040, could be as much as US $7.1 trillion equivalent to ~85% of global spending on health in 2018. ©Hermes Rivera /Unslh/ WWF'.

Photo by WWF International on September 10, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, body of water and text that says 'The lifetime cost of the plastic produced 2019 will be at least US $3.7 trillion and more than the GDP GDP of India. © Spartan Xozz /Unsplash WWF'.

node.text:
We are witnessing a planetary crisis unfold in real time.

Wildfires, floods: it’s never been clearer that our relationship with nature is broken. So where do we go from here? 👇 #WWFUntangled

We need to start working WITH nature instead of AGAINST nature. Nature-based solutions harness the power of the natural world in a way that benefits us and all life on this planet. 🌍

Did you know that, if all mangroves were lost or destroyed, 15 million more people would be affected by floods across the world each year? 

And that forests provide clean air and water, protect against erosion and landslides, and help to regulate the climate by removing carbon from the atmosphere? 🌊🌲

The natural world does so much to sustain and protect us. We must do more to help it thrive, and we must do it now. Double tap if you agree!

#NaturePositive #WWF #Biodiversity #Climate #ClimateChange #GlobalWarming #ClimateCrisis #ClimateAction #SaveThePlanet  #NoPlanetB #ClimateChangeIsReal #ClimateStrike #ClimateEmergency #ClimateJustice

node.text:
🌳COVID-19 has heavily affected people in the Amazonas region of Brazil. Transporting food supplies to forest communities meant they didn’t have to risk contracting the disease in their nearest cities 🙏

💪We need to protect the Amazon rainforest, so the local communities can continue their way of life 🌳 #WorldAmazonDay

#AmazonRainforest #WWFBrazil #COVID19 #Amazon #Amazonas #ProtectAmazonia #NatureLovers #OurPlanetDaily #ProtectPeople #ProtectNature

node.text:
Pandemics. Food insecurity. Rising global temperatures. Never has it been clearer that our relationship with nature is broken – but how exactly do we move towards a better future? 🌍

This urgent question requires an urgent solution, and this week’s #IUCNWorldCongress looks at how we can tackle it together. 

The #IUCNWorldCongress this year comes at a crucial time⏳ It’s happening ahead of important UN decision-making meetings on climate, nature loss, and food systems. 

And these decisions guide humanity’s relationship with our planet for the decades ahead. We MUST address nature loss and the #ClimateCrisis, and send a reminder to Governments that #TheRaceIsOn to turn the tide now. Tap the link in our bio to learn more!

#ClimateChange #NoPlanetB #ClimateEmergency #ClimateChangeIsReal #ClimateStrike #GlobalWarming #ClimateJustice #ClimateAction #SaveThePlanet

node.text:
⚠️Warning, the following images may be devastating⚠️

This is no longer just a recurrence of natural disasters! This is a climate crisis and an EMERGENCY and we need action. 

Together we can stop fires, care for injured wildlife and help build a sustainable rescue and rehabilitation capacity.

Follow the link in our bio to find out how you can help to prevent more devastation.

#TurkeyIsBurning #GreeceIsBurning #WildFires #ClimateCrisis #ClimateEmergency #NoPlanetB #ItalyWildfire #AmazonIsBurning #CaliforniaFires

node.text:
The Ministerial Conference on Marine Plastic Pollution gets underway in less than 48 hours.

We need global action to stop plastic pollution in our oceans 🌍

This is our last chance to tell governments we need urgent action to tackle the plastic pollution crisis.

Together with over 2 million people, your voice can make a difference. Follow the link in our bio to sign the petition. 

#StopPlasticPollution #PlasticPollution #PlasticPollutes #Microplastic #PlasticWaste #SayNoToPlastic #Plastic #ZeroPlastic #Petition #SaveTheOcean #OceanCleanUp #OceanConservation #MarineConservation #PlasticFree #PlasticFreeLiving #PlasticSucks

node.text:
💙Nothing is more important than water. But freshwater resources are increasingly over-stretched.

And it’s only going to get worse with #ClimateChange - with more intense droughts on the way for many parts of the world, according to the latest report on the climate crisis by @ipcc 🌏

This #WorldWaterWeek is an opportunity to call for urgent global efforts to protect and restore healthy rivers, lakes and wetlands - to help build resilience faster.

Otherwise, even wildlife could get tangled up in conflicts over water…

#ClimateCrisis #ProtectPeople #ProtectNature #Water #NatureLovers #ElephantsOfInstagram #GiraffesOfInstagram #WildlifeLovers

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by WWF International on August 23, 2021. May be an image of 4 people and outdoors.

node.text:
⚠️The latest report on the #ClimateCrisis by @ipcc left no room for doubt. #ClimateChange is causing more extreme floods, droughts, wildfires and storms. And these natural disasters are only going to get worse - hammering communities and economies across the world ⛈🌊🔥

💪 This #WorldWaterWeek, we are spreading the message that we need to build resilience faster! 

To achieve this we must urgently and drastically scale up investment in healthy rivers, lakes and wetlands to adapt to the worsening, water-related impacts of climate change. 

Putting healthy freshwater ecosystems at the heart of global efforts to build resilience will help us build a #NaturePositive world.

Head to our Story to read the full blog. 

#ClimateCrisis #ProtectPeople #ProtectPlanetEarth #Water #ValueWater

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by WWF International on August 23, 2021. May be an image of body of water and text that says 'Ghost gearis the deadliest form of marine plastic debris. ©naturepl. naturepl.com/ Jordi Chias WWF'.

node.text:
Fishing equipment lost or abandoned at sea is known as ghost gear. It can continue trapping and killing marine life for decades after it enters the ocean 🐢🐋🐟
Thanks to the voices of 2.1 million people, more than 100 countries are supporting the call for a #PlasticsTreaty to #StopPlasticPollution.

But we need more government support to make the Plastics Treaty a reality. The Ministerial Conference on Plastic Pollution takes place on 1-2 September. 

Follow the link in our bio to call on governments to join the conference and be the champions of solving the plastic pollution crisis ✊ 

#PlasticPollution #PlasticPollutes #Microplastic #PlasticWaste #Plastic #ZeroPlastic #Petition #SaveTheOcean #OceanCleanUp #OceanConservation #MarineConservation #PlasticFree #PlasticFreeLiving
